domain

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player class is a representation of a player of the monopoly game. It holds the players id for internal uses, has the player's name and the balance.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()

      • Player

        public Player(int id,
              java.lang.String name,
              int balance)
        Primary constructor for player. Initialises a player at the initial start of the game. It takes 3 arguments id-player's id, name-player's name, balance-player's initial balance. Also it sets the private fields of player inJail, finished, bankrupt booleans to false. And puts the player to the "Go" square.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of a player for display purposes
        name - the name of the player for display purposes as a string
        balance - the total money of the player as an int

      • publishToPlayerLocationObservers

        public void publishToPlayerLocationObservers()
        For each player location observer the player has, the method publishes a change for the observers to react.
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt player
        Modifies:
        each player location observer in the list of observers
        Effects:
        calls observer.playerLocationUpdated(this) for each observer in the observer list

      • deposit

        public void deposit(int amount)
        Deposits a non-negative integer to the player's total balance. If the user enters a negative amount, the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        amount - the int value to be deposit
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-null player, non-negative integer amount
        Modifies:
        the player, the player's balance
        Effects:
        if a player is null, throws NullPointerException. If the amount is a negative integer, throwss IllegalArgumentException. Else sets player's balance to be getBalance() + amount.

      • withdraw

        public void withdraw(int amount)
        Withdraws a non-negative integer from the player's total balance.
        Parameters:
        amount - the int value to be withdraw
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-null player, non-negative integer amount
        Modifies:
        the player, the player's balance
        Effects:
        If a player is null, throws NullPointerException. If the argument is a negative value, throws IllegalArgument Eception. Else if player's balance is (getBalance() - amount > 0), the method sets the player's balance with setBalance(getBalance() - amount). else, the method sets the balance to 0 and flags player bankrupt.

      • transfer

        public void transfer(Player targetPlayer,
                     int amount)
        Transfers a specific amount from the player to the target player. If the transfer amount is a negative number, the method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        targetPlayer - the player which the money would be transferred to
        amount - the int amount to transfer
        Requires:
        an amount to transfer, source-player: a non-bankrupt and non-null player with a balance which is greater than or equal to the amount to transfer., target-player: a non-bankrupt and non-null player
        Modifies:
        source-player, target-player
        Effects:
        If either player is null, throws NullPointerException. If either player is bankrupt, throws IllegalArgumentException. Else withdraws the amount from the source-player and then deposits the amount to the target-player. If the source-player's balance is smaller than the amount to transfer, deposits the total balance of the source-player to the target-player and sets the source-players balance to zero and sets his bankrupt field to true.

      • payRent

        public void payRent(domain.Property p)
        Pays the rent of the property which the player is on to it's respective owner.
        Parameters:
        p - the property the player is currently on
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-pull player to be on an owned property which he/she is not the owner of the property.
        Modifies:
        the player, owner
        Effects:
        If the property is null or the player is null throws NullPointerException. If the property's owner is null or either player is bankrupt, throws IllegalArgumentException. Else withdraws the rent of the Property p, from the source-player and then deposits the amount to the target-player. If the source-player's balance is smaller than rent, deposits the total balance of the source-player to the target-player and sets the source-player bankrupt.

      • buyProperty

        public boolean buyProperty(domain.Property p)
        Buys the unowned property that the player has landed on if the player can afford it. Returns true if the player has completed the process or else false.
        Parameters:
        p - the location of the player
        Returns:
        true, if player can buy the Property p, else false.
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-null player, an unowned property which is the location of the player
        Modifies:
        the player, the property the player has landed on, the Player's estates or transitStations or utilities or cabCompanies depending on the property's type.
        Effects:
        If the property is owned or the player is bankrupt throws IllegalArgumentException. Else withdraws the base price of the Property p, from the source-player. Sets {p.setOwner(this)} and adds the Property p to it's respective lists. Checks whether the player has any monopoly or majority ownership on any estate kind.

      • givePropertyTo

        public void givePropertyTo(Player targetPlayer,
                           domain.Property p)
        Gives the specific property from the player to the target player.
        Parameters:
        targetPlayer - the player which will receive the property
        p - the property which is being transferred
        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-null player who owns has a property, a non-bankrupt and non-null target player
        Modifies:
        the player, the specific property, targetPlayer, targetPlayer's estates or transitStations or utilities or cabCompanies depending on Property p's type.
        Effects:
        If either player is null throws NullPointerException. If the property which is being transferred is null, throws IllegalArgumentException. Else removes the property from the player's respective property lists. Set the owner of the property to targetPlayer and adds it to targetPlayer's respective lists. Finally updates the majority and monopoly estates of both the player and targetPlayer.

      • releaseAllProperties

        public void releaseAllProperties()
        Releases all the properties a player has.
        Requires:
        the player has at least 1 property in at least 1 property-list type.
        Modifies:
        this, player's estates or transitStations or utilities or cabCompanies depending on Property p's type.
        Effects:
        Removes all the properties that the player's has from their respective list.

        Effects:

        Requires:
        a non-bankrupt and non-null player
        Effects:
        If the player has no majority ownership, returns an empty an empty list.
